page.title: 04DUDMASTON GROUNDS CONT.
page.content:
For much of this century the water which overflowed was used to power a hydraulic ram which supplied the entire estate. As the water cascades off the dam it flows through the ram pipe for distribution. In 1980 the government changed its regulations; this meant that the dam wall had to be strengthened so that it could withstand flashfloods or accidents. This cost many thousands of pounds. The{hall and grounds}are{open}to {visitors}3 afternoons a week:- Sundays. School parties on Thursdays by special arrangement.
Prices are{60p for students}and Â£1.20 for adults.
